Description: Vessel made of calcite in a very eroded state that was used as a kohl pot. Most parts of the rim are broken off. The interior is hollowed out comparatively deep and with straight sides. The base is flat and the vessel is tapered to the base while the shoulders are quite wide. At the exterior as well as interior salt accretions on the surface.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.1 (AWI - possibly from D14.26z), by threshold, below Ramesside floor level
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 108)
